headline: Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: The best recipe for chocolate chip cookies, much-loved and even award-winning with a secret ingredient — instant pudding mix. Always a favorite.

video.description: See how to bake a top-rated chocolate chip cookie.
video.name: Award-Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies

name: Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipeIngredient: 2 (3.4 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Sift together flour and baking soda in a medium bowl, set aside.
Cream together butter, brown sugar, and white sugar in a large bowl. Beat in instant pudding mix until blended. Stir in eggs and vanilla.
Add flour mixture to the butter mixture until it's well incorporated. Fold in chocolate chips and nuts.
Drop cookies by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake in batches in the preheated oven until the edges are golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes, switching racks halfway through.

review.reviewBody: Quick and easy reciepe. added walnuts too. Very moist. now my new favorite choc chip/walnut cookie, soft!!
They're good. They're not the best but they're a solid reliable good cookie
by far the best ever!
I use this as my base. I use 1/2 whole wheat flour 1/2 white. Add dark choc powder to flour mixture.Noo pudding, no nuts and use different types of chocolate; dark, semi etc.

I used 1 box of pudding and cut the brown sugar by 1/2 c. Other ingredients per recipe. Chilled the dough for 30m before dropping. These came out with a light and fluffy texture, kept their loft for the most part even w/ medium scoop, achieved lightly brown edges at 350 (convection) for 12m. Agree with all the comments - 1) def. requires a good mixer with a lot of horsepower (dough is very substantial; my KitchenAid was chugging, even w/ 1 box of pudding); absolutely needs salt (if you're interested in the classic choc chip cookie taste). Generally, they're good, I liked the loft and cake-ness of them and they are not too sweet w/ reduced sugar. But the taste to me is a bit bland. Def. not that Toll House flavor profile. Maybe the salt or extra vanilla as others advise would do the trick. Not sure I'd go w/ this recipe again but they are absolutely puffy vs. flat which is what I was looking for.

Turned out AMAZING. Everyone loved them and asked for the recipe. I read several reviews prior to baking and several said they came out thin or didn’t rise so the only change I made was I chilled the dough for about an hour in the mixing bowl prior to baking them, then formed them on the baking sheets for cooking. They came out soft, fluffy and delicious!
I've being using this recipe for years and kids love them and where ever I take them people love them. Best recipe out there
BEST Chocolate chip cookie recipe! I’ve been making these for years! No matter where I bring these, I receive so many compliments. EVERYONE WANTS THE RECIPE. This recipe is a MUST SAVE!

Best cookies ever ! gove you 5+ stars I try to bake these cookies every holiday, especially Christmas for the families that we care about and love I lost service recipe and we’re so glad to find it. Again thank you everybody loves them . I made one batch and they loved it there gone last week so I’m making another batch today. Thank you thank you thank you

I found this recipe on this site years ago. My kids know it as ‘Mom’s Secret Ingredient Chocolate Chip Cookies’. People BEG me for this recipe! They are sooo good. I always put a batch in the freezer. The only difference that I do, is use margarine instead of butter. When I use butter they spread all over. (even when thoroughly chilled)
Family favorite.
I made these a few years back and my mother-in-law loved them. This time I used French Vanilla vs Vanilla and they turned out even better.
Really good recipe.

I stayed with the original recipe except for 1 thing when I pulled the deliciousness from the oven I immediately sprinkled ground cinnamon on each cookie. The light sprinkling on the hot morsels seemes to have melted deep into the flavor and wow what a magnificent burst of flavor. 5 Star recipe.

I made only half of the recipe and got 18 cookies using a medium cookie scoop. They spread quite a bit so next time I will refrigerate the dough prior to baking the cookies. A little too soft for my taste but otherwise pretty tasty.

These are good. Not the best chocolate chip cookies I've ever had, but still good. I found them a tad sweet, so I might cut back on the sugar next time. It would be helpful to state how big to portion out the dough. I used a medium cookie scoop and only got 52 medium cookies (about 2 3/4 inch diameter), nowhere close to 72! I would suggest chilling the dough before baking, to prevent them from spreading too much. A simple recipe that the kids can help with.
yyyyuuuuummmmmmmmmyyyyyy very yummy
This recipe is almost the same as mine. I loved it. I did reduce the ingredients to half and used mini chocolate chips. All the cookies came out perfect.

I made these cookies according to the recipe and they turned out great! I added white chocolate chips, semi sweet chocolate chunks, and dark chocolate chips as well as pecans. I allowed my customers to try a free cookie and everyone loved them. I highly recommend this recipe for everyone.
AWESOME!!!

I've made this recipe over 20 times. Here are 5 TIPS: 1) Don't let butter melt. Let it stand at room temp for 30min. 2) Make sure your baking soda is no more than 18 months old. Less than 6 months even better. 3) Important to cream together white sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla pudding MIX (not made pudding), and butter prior to adding other ingredients. 4) Add a tsp of salt. 5) Refrigerate dough overnight before baking. I also more times than not half the recipe.
Best Chocolate chip cookie!! So soft and made a ton!! I added dark chocolate and Milk to give it more surprises and they were to die for. Thank you for sharing!!!!

I have searched everywhere for an easy soft chocolate chip cookie recipe. I followed the directions exactly and I was very impressed. My kids (and husband) were gobbling them down before they were even cool on the racks. Thanks for the great recipe! Edited to add: I have used this recipe for years now and I am often asked about it. My favorite way to make them is half chocolate chips and half peanut butter chips. I only make half the recipe, as my mixer struggles with the full recipe.

This recipe is great. I have made it twice and it worked both times. I tweaked it by making half the recipe. I added both semi-sweet and milk chocolate chips. Lastnight, I also added a heaping teaspoon of Moringa vegetable powder. My son doesn't know and he can't taste it. Perfect. Thank you.

As soon as I seen the bubbles in cookie on the picture I could tell there was a little to much baking soda so I scaled mine back alittle and incorporated my ingredients throughly. They came out pretty good no baking soda taste.
Easy and fast. Very soft.

I adjusted the recipe for 36 and got 72 cookies out of this. I must have used a smaller scoop then they did in their recipe. My husband and I like the smaller size. These are the best cookies we have ever made. He loves cookies and I have experimented with tons of different recipes. The only thing I can think is the pudding gives it a richness that the others cookies didn’t have. I was really skeptical at first of using it in a cookie. I baked them in a convection oven for 12 minutes and they were perfect. Light can crispy on the bottom and edges soft in the middle. My husband told me these are his Ultimate favorite I’ve ever made. I made 2 dozen and put the rest in the freezer. So I hope the second batch will be good too. I usually do this with my other recipes. It’s so nice to have a dessert option that you can make in about 12 minutes. Just pull out a few from the freezer wait for the over to heat up and you have fresh cookies. He is always so surprised when I do this. OMG you made these so quick. It’s also one of his favorite smells in the house (cookies and bread)
Love to bake this recipe. I've been making it for years and it's always a hit!

I used this recipe as a base recipe where I substituted the vanilla pudding with banana pudding, and also substituted the chocolate chips with white chocolate chips. ABSOLUTELY THE BEST COOKIE RECIPE I HAVE EVER USED!!!!!!
These are the BEST!!!!!! I do add butterscotch chips in with the chocolate chips sometimes!??

This recipe is THE BOMB!! This is by far the BEST chocolate chip cookie recipe I have ever made. You will absolutely throw rocks at every other recipe you have ever used. The cookies are soft and full of flavor— a huge success!!
My family favorite for years!

These are amazing every time and people always tell me that they are the best cookies that they've ever had. If you are a crunchy cookie lover, this recipe is not for you. No need to give it one star! If the cookies didn't turn out for you, then you probably missed a step or ingredient. I follow it to a T, have made it several times, and always get rave reviews!

I’ve been making these chocolate chip cookies since I was in high school! I’m 25 now and this is still my go to recipe. I bake them low and slow and they always turn out amazing. The cookies come out so soft and yummy! You can’t even tell pudding mix was added but it adds a softness. I love to heat them up for about 5 seconds when I have them. 5/5!
Amazing. No regrets.
Quick and easy recipe, with great flavor! So soft on the inside and crispy on the edges!
Cookies came out great! I added about 5 more mins to the baking time and baked at 360.

This recipe has been my go to for a while now. I use the dough without the chocolate chips as a sugar cookie to rave reviews. I also substitute the vanilla pudding for chocolate to bake a double chocolate chip cookie variation.

I followed the recipe as is just made a small batch to see if it was as good as everybody says. This recipe was not exceptional or extraordinary as every body raves. I could feel the taste of the pudding mix which to me was not exactly what I expected given that everybody says it won't be noticeable. I digress. Also, they were too cakey and not as soft as I expected them to be. The result is not bad but definitely is nothing extraordinary. Best Chocolate Chip Cookies from this site yields a much better chocolate flavor without the unnecessary pudding/cake flavor.

The cookies were easy to make. I expected more flavor. I halved the recipe as I didn't need 72. I also added only half chocolate chips because I don't really like alot of c.chips. I would sub the walnuts with pecans the next time, I think they would have added another flavor profile that you don't get from the Walnuts.

These cookies are amazing! By far my favorite chocolate chip cookie that I have found in this site. Whoever else was having a problem with these they were doing something wrong. This recipe comes out perfect, chewy, and delicious every time.

Fantastic recipe. I didn’t have vanilla pudding, but I had the small banana pudding boxes, so I use those. So so so yummy! I can’t wait to make these with chocolate putting and the original vanilla that the recipe calls for. I almost never leave reviews but this one is an all star!?

It was pretty good. I don't like nuts in cookies very much so I took out the nuts.
Also:
used 2 Tbsp of Vanilla instead of 1 tsp
1 tsp salt
1 tsp baking powder
I liked it this way better than the original recipe.

I made this for a good friend’s birthday party. It was an instant hit! The most outspoken person initially thought they looked under done and like dough until he picked one up and ate it. He literally ate 1/3 of the batch. I will say that due to the number of people at the party, I cut the recipe in half. Also, instead of all semi-sweet chocolate chips, I used 1 cup of mini semi-sweet chocolate chips and 1 cup of butterscotch chips. I also took the advice of previous reviewers and used a pampered chef stone and in a convection oven. Doing it that way had me baking them for about 18 minutes. They ended up perfect and people asking how much they would pay me to make them for birthday parties. Great recipe!
These cookies were delicious
Simply amazing!

This is my go to cookie recipe! I've made it exactly as written and I've adjusted for different flavors! Perfect everytime! I've changed pudding flavors, ½ vanilla½ almond extracts, or/and different chips. I cook for exactly 9½ minutes for my perfect doneness. I will also cook half and freeze half dough balls for cookies now AND cookies fresh later (cook a few minutes longer for frozen dough balls). You can not go wrong with this perfect recipe!

This chocolate chip cookie recipe wasn’t too bad . I read reviews first . It is true that extra salt and vanilla extract helps . 
I’m a toll house cookie fan and wanted these to be a close match . I made the whole batch . I baked a few at a time on parchment paper. I prefer a small soft chewy cookie. These were soft but too many chocolate chips for me . Next time I will put less in. I did need more salt . My first batch tasted bland , I sprinkled salt on a already baked cookie just to taste the difference and it tasted much better. Overall I did like this recipe. I used my Kitchenaid to mix everything and followed the instructions . I also added walnuts and I placed the dough in the refrigerator 2 hours before baking . They taste pretty good! Thanks !

I made half of what it calls for and they are the best I have ever made. Giving them to my neighbor's son who help be shovel the drive. It is also a gift for him for going into the Air Force. Hoping the whole family likes them too.

I have been using this recipe for the past few years and it is foolproof- I’ve never made a less than perfect batch yet, following the recipe to a t every time. I get rave reviews every time and have shared this recipe a dozen times. It’s my favorite place n the site. Thank you for sharing this wonderful recipe, Debbi!

I’m always searching for the best chocolate chip cookie recipe. I was pleasantly surprised with how good this cookie tastes. I think the cake like texture is why it’s so tasty. Here’s what I did: I used country crock plant butter, added espresso and two tablespoons of vanilla. These cookies are chewy on the outside and cakey on the inside. JUST YUMMY
I dont usually bother to comment, but DAMMM! THESE ARE AMAZING.
This is the best chocolate chip cookie recipe that I have found, yet!! Everyone loves them!!

I followed the recipe as written. I have never seen a CC cookie recipe with pudding in the mix so i thought i have to try it. These were very good cookies but not my favorite recipe. My oven took longer to cook them than the directions but that’s the difference in ovens. All in all a good cookie with a twist.
Best recipie ever!!!! I haven't tried another since I've found it. They get even better there day after you make them.

I don't normally leave a review, but I have to with this recipe! I've been baking for 50 years and these are hands down the best chocolate chip cookies I've ever made! They aren't going to last long in this house! Highly recommend

These are the best! I’ve been making these for ages. This cookie recipe is for people who love more of a cakey cookie rather than a crispy one. I always make about 12 cookies and freeze the rest, perfect for portion controlling.
I'm 70 years old, so I've been baking for a long time. This is the BEST chocolate chip cookie I've ever made!

These are DELICIOUS. I have a recipe I have been making for 20 years and these will be my new go-to. I made them as-is the first time and they were wonderful, but my personal preference is a little bit of salt and I always go extra on the vanilla, so I did that the second time and they were even better. I just bought six boxes of pudding to have on hand so I can make these whenever I want.

I’ve been baking the same chocolate chip recipe (Hershey recipe) for 30 years with rave reviews but when I saw 3 recipes on here with over 10k positive reviews I knew I had try to try them so I decided to bake all 4 recipes and have them blind tasted. 10 of my friends which included 2 professional bakers participated and these were the results:
Award winning - everybody agreed that these were too sweet. The bakers were intrigued by the unique flavour though. Without the pudding mix I believe these would have won or maybe less sugar. 
Best chocolate chip - these were too dense (I knew even before baking them the amount of flour was going to be too much). 
Best big fat and Hershey - these were the top contenders. And both very good. It came down to texture preference as Hershey is a drop cookie and crispier whereas best cookies were soft and chewy. 
This was fun and hopefully helps out
This is my go to recipe. I’ve tried dozens of youtube videos... But nothing was as good as this recipe.
Soft and tasty. I still prefer Tollhouse.

Instead of white sugar I substituted Lakanto brand sweetener Erythritol Monk Fruit blend from Costco. 

My girls loved it and will definitely bake them again.

These are the BEST chocolate chip cookies ever. They came out perfect in shape and amazing in taste! I followed exactly - but halved the recipe. The texture was crumbly at first, but I kept mixing and they finally became the correct texture. I will definitely make these again! Goodbye family recipe.

Thank you to all the comments that made tweaks! This recipe is delicious, I am not sure for those who got it wrong, but I used butterscotch chips and caramel pudding with white chocolate chips. I did exactly what was additionally suggested from other bakers, from mixing the powder pudding into the creamed, soft butter sugar blend to adding extra vanilla and a little salt. I had no issues on the first try and I look forward to making other combinations with this mixture.
Ive been using this recipe for YEARS ! When I say years, I mean many many years. Never disappoints.
Always soft and delicious
Most amazing cookies I've ever tasted. I changed the 2 teaspoons to 2 tablespoons. I made them for Christmas for my family.
These are the best cookies I've had in my life.
i white instead 0f white sugar i used 1 cup powder sugar and instead of 4 cups of chocolate i did half of raisons

I have been making these for years and have always gotten rave reviews. I noticed the last two times I made them, they hardly spread out and came out as chunky lumps and didn't spread out. After at least 15 years of making these, I'm in search of a new recipe. My little granddaughter spilled the beans last time I made them and said that "my mom said you didn't use enough butter" but I've been making them the same exact way for eons. I I did get a new stove around 8 years ago and I just noticed this difference this past Christmas and when I made a batch a few weeks ago (inJuly). Has any long-time bakers noticed this? I'm wondering if maybe the butter is not the same as it's always been...they add water to everything nowadays to make a better profit in the supermarkets!

First batch was sugary and undercooked. Second batch, 375 for thirteen minutes - sugary and undercooked. Third batch I dropped the tray from the middle to a lower rack. Better. Fourth batch I made the cookies smaller. That did it. So for my oven and altitude and humidity - smaller cookies on a lower rack at 375 for thirteen minutes. And after all that, in my opinion, they’re “ok”. Definitely not the best ever.
really outstanding. I used butter flavor crisco instead of butter and pecans instead of walnuts. I sprinkled a little coarse ground salt on each cookie before baking.
This is our favorite chocolate chip cookie recipe! However, I omit the nuts because they are expensive and use dark chocolate chips instead of semisweet (my personal preference).
I added one tsp of salt to the recipe, the cookies are so tasty and soft, everyone loves them
delicious recipe ! easy with awesome results

The taste and consistency of these cookies were nearly identical to my regular cookie recipe. I won't be going out of my way to buy vanilla pudding mix to make these again when I can make chocolate chip cookies with what I already have in the kitchen. I should also mention that this recipe should be halved unless you're a very large family.
These cookies are delicious even my parents love them
Made these turned out excellent.
These are my go to chocolate chip cookies. A perfect recipe.

I'm not really handy in the kitchen being a bachelor, but this recipe is easy and makes really good cookies. Tips: makes 7 dozen fair-sized cookies; have a strong mixer (I burned mine up); the sugar mix is very thick and mixing by hand isn't going to happen; have several cookie sheets; have a lot of cookie-loving friends; have two big bowls.
Sooo good and perfect.
Best cookies! The recipe is so delicious and you can use whatever flavor pudding, amazing! I’ve used French Vanilla and Chocolate Fudge so far.. Yummy!
Great cookies super soft and chewy. Really good in cupcake form as well lol
I’ve made these twice now, both times using 1/4c less white sugar and 1/4c less brown sugar. These are PERFECT! My house is in love with these and so much for losing weight anytime soon. So soft!
I’ve made this recipe for years! My kids and husband love these cookies. They’re traditional and have a little something extra special from the pudding.
I was not in love with this cookie.. first I should have halved the recipe and not fond of the walnuts too much.
no
Too sweet. Too many chocolate chips. Too much flour. Too bad, I have too many cookies we don't like.

I made this recipe and it turned out really good. The only thing that I changed was the amount of sugar, I cut the sugar in half and they turned out perfect for me. I don't like anything that is too sweet so cutting the sugar in half was perfect and they are still sweet enough for others to enjoy. My boyfriend had one right after I made them and he said that its the best chocolate chip cookie he's ever had.

These are THE BEST. Cuz it was Easter I used Cadbury mini eggs (broken up) instead of chocolate chips. I did add baking soda and extra vanilla as others suggested. AMAZING. Only thing is I kept the dough in the fridge over night. The next day it was rock solid. Took all my strength to get the dough into my scooper.

I have made these for going on 10 years. It’s literally the best cookie recipe ever! I make this big batch for our vacation bible school every summer and my church family raves over them! This will go down as a family recipe for years to come!
Definitely will make it again.

I have made these cookies twice and they are really good. Each time I made a half of the recipe and ended up with 3 dozen cookies. The secret to keeping them soft is don't press them down. I use a smallish melon scoop and they turn out perfect. They also freeze well which is great because there are only two of us in my household. Highly recommend them.
I loved them and so did my grandchildren. They are the most important if the grandkids do not like I will never make again. The best!!
I added abit more vanilla, but these have got to be the best chocolate chip cookies i have made yet!!! I love the vanilla pudding!!!

I've made these cookies probably 40x. They are the absolute best out there. I suggest topping them with flaked sea salt or at least using salted butter. I also try to stir the batter as little as possible to keep them light (but still chewy/cakey/delicious). I also don't use a scooper, i drop them using my hand and barely getting them into circular balls (i don't roll them at all). Just my tips since i have friends try to make them and they taste different!
My fav cookie recipe

These are THE BEST choc chip cookies I’ve ever made. I didn’t add the pudding, but they were still VERY good. On April 1st, I had so many, I gave myself a stomach ache! Not to mention the COOKIE DOUGH on the attachment and spatula! All in all, they were very good. Cudos to whoever made this recipe.

item.name: Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies
